questions.question_text: What are two things that should be done before upgrading from vCloud Networking and Security to NSX? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Ensure that forward and reverse DNS is functional

questions.question_text:
A user has configured a specific distributed firewall rule preventing VM-A (172.16.10.11) on the Web-Logical Switch to communicate to VM-B (172.16.20.11), running on the same switch. After the changes, the user is still able to communicated to VM-A from VM-B.
To debug this anomaly, the user will need to obtain logs from which component?

discussion.content: "needs"... This is either a trick question or trash. You "need" a truck port. The "sink port being employed on the trunk port group is best practice, but not necessarily required.

C - Sink.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-Data-Center-for-vSphere/6.2/com.vmware.nsx.admin.doc/GUID-C9E2B0E4-F1C1-44A7-B142-F814F801FA42.html

"If the trunk port group is on a vSphere Distributed Switch you must do the following:
...
Enable sink port for the trunk vNic, or enable promiscuous mode. Enabling a sink port is the recommended best practice."

comments.content:
Agree with C - Sink port. I saw this in my VMware Lab for the NSX-V training. 
Task 2: Create a port group on the distributed switch for the sink port. You create a port group on the distributed switch for the sink interface used by the L2VPN feature.

questions.question_text: When deploying a standalone NSX Edge as a Layer 2 VPN client, which port needs to be configured on the client vSphere Distributed Switch?
With which Application Profile types would the Insert X-Forwarded-For HTTP header option be used?

discussion.content:
Option “C” is the correct answer according to me because you will have to redistribute the routes learned via OSPF into BGP in order to reach the physical router/downstream IP192.168.150.10.

Option "D” is an incorrect answer because, though you have enabled “Enable Default Originate” on edge-2 for BGP, How OSPF routes will inject into BGP without redistribution? As per me, by enabling the “Enable Default Originate” on BGP will allow the ESG to advertise itself as a default gateway to its peers however it will not redistribute ospf routes into BGP.

choices.A: Enable Default Originate on edge-2 for OSPF.
choices.B: Configure static routes on the physical router.
choices.C: Enable route redistribution on edge-2 between both routing protocols.
choices.D: Enable Default Originate on edge-2 for BGP
